thanks so much for joining us today
thank you it's great to be here could
you please uh share a little bit about
some of the programs you've been
involved in one of the things I've been
involved with is helping establish an
affiliate for women in cyber security in
Utah specifically
it was one of the areas that as I looked
around as a cyber security leader in
Utah I found that there wasn't
representation for women in cyber
security to both attract train and
promote within the industry and so with
some other cyber security leaders
a professor from Southern Utah
University and then some from industry
so both focusing on academic and
Industry we founded that affiliation in
Utah and right now I think we're around
100 members oh that's fantastic as a
security professional were there any
sort of aha moments when you started
using the Cloud just sort of seeing what
what the power of the cloud was and how
it how it affected your security
capabilities and organization yeah I can
think a couple instances
um yeah go back just as the frame of
reference we were so entrenched as an
on-premise company for so many years it
was almost like this mythical idea of
going to the cloud like everybody's
doing it but did we really uh know what
the benefit would be and night one the
big cut over everybody's there all night
and one of our key applications
performance wasn't quite there and we
had AWS was there with us they said Hold
on put up a temporary you know notice on
it we're going to pull that down we'll
resize it and bring it back up 10
minutes later it's like oh yeah it's
working perfectly and everybody kind of
looked at each other like how'd that
just happen like before we would have
been ordering new servers waited a month
to get them into the data center I was
like okay we've really got some power
here and as that started to transform
you know for the security team we now
had great visibility to our assets right
what plagues a lot of security teams
Asset Management right we could query
our environment we could see our assets
we could monitor them we could start
building out as I mentioned earlier like
config rules to adjust for them so it
really became an accelerant to our
capabilities
um and you know we knew what we had
right and what our position was so Mark
you know you've you've been a CSO for a
while in the security industry for quite
some time
um what do you see the evolution of the
CSO becoming in the next five or ten
years and or you know from a technology
perspective I I think the CSO is going
to continue to evolve as you know we
talk about garnering that seat at the
table that's been the that's been the
milestone for a long time I think we're
starting to reach that as csos the next
element is going to be
and that's going to continue to elevate
up you know see shows who developed
their business Acumen to understand the
strategy of the business the connect the
business objectives clearly to security
value their
um value and position in the
organization as a strategic advisor will
only continue to grow and so you know
maybe that is even you know I see some
csos who are moving into CTO CIO roles
but I could even see an evolution with
CEO kind of roles operational risks
Chief risk officers you know evolving as
well awesome Mark thanks so much for
joining us today absolutely it's a
pleasure to be here thank you foreign
